results.title: Can't you bloody-well read?!
results.creator_credit: John Dick, Max Pepper, Pepper Audio Visual and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A poignant study of adult illiteracy and its effect on the lives of one in ten adults in our community. The Department of Further Education is working on a new program that may provide an answer in the field of reading education. The aim of the film is to remove some of the shame illiterate people in the community feel, and to convince them they should do something about it.

results.title: Camera magic: the art of special effects
results.creator_credit: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates a variety of camera techniques which can be used to produce special effects with an ordinary 16mm or 8mm motion picture camera without employing special equipment. Shows rotation in space, multiple images, upside down and reverse action, instant appearance and disappearance of objects and people and fast and slow motion. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.title_for_label: Camera magic: the art of special effects
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Samuelson, Paul Burnford and Pyramid Films

results.title: River red gum
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, Michael Vance, Victoria. Ministry for Conservation and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
Shows the river red gum in its natural habitat, sheltering caterpillars, tiny marsupial carnivores, mistletoe birds, spitfires and saw flies. Also contains unique footage of ants farming slow-witted caterpillars for their sweet sticky secretions, in a three way business arrangement with the tree.

results.title: Camille Claudel
results.brief_description: Artistic genius and the descent into madness are at the centre of this stunning drama about Camille Claudel. An independent woman, she ventured into the male dominated sphere of sculpture in the 1880’s and left an indelible mark on the genre. After achieving an apprenticeship to renowned sculptor, Auguste Rodin (24 years older than she), and reaching a level of intimacy with him, she longs for more. His refusal initiates a decline in their relationship and her sanity. Based upon the biography of Camille Claudel by Rein-Marie Paris, great niece of Camille, this hauntingly dark and brooding film will sweep its audience along the raging torrent that was Camille Claudel’s life. Stars Gerard Depardieu and Isabelle Adjani. English subtitles with French dialogue.

results.title: Creek and billabong
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, Michael Vance and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
Observes insect, bird and animal life around creeks and billabongs-the metamorphosis of a grublike mudeye into a dragonfly, yabbies, a kingfisher begging a meal from another kingfisher, a caddis fly building itself a sort of flying fortress to swim about in - and explains with superb close-ups, why wrigglers wriggle. The interrelationship of creatures living in these two aquatic environments, and the food chains of animal life found in freshwater are shown. Depicts the metamorphosis of the dragon-fly and the mosquito and looks at the caddis-fly, yappy, platypus, Murray cod and the water-rat.

results.title: Camel
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wildlife Australia”.
A study of the history of the camel in Australia and the way the animal has adapted to the environment. Corrects some of the popular misconceptions about the camel and its habitat and shows people who work with them in the outback. Two other introduced species - horses and donkeys - are also mentioned.

results.title: Camille 2000
results.creator_credit: Radley Metzger, Spear Productions and Audubon Films
results.brief_description: The swinging sixties are reflected in this free-love erotica romance produced and directed by Radley Metzger. Portrayed via highly stylised costume and set design, the hedonistic lifestyle indulged by Marguerite (Daniele Gaubert) and her friends is in the realm of fantasy. How the very wealthy (or proteges of the wealthy such as Marguerite) spend their time - with wild parties, drugs and alcohol fuelling their passions. The swarthy Armand (Nino Castenuovo) arrives in Rome and instantly falls for Marguerite, upsetting the ‘live for now’ approach she has to love. They begin an affair that sees them run away to live on a yacht until Armand’s father intervenes trying to save his son’s money and reputation. Marguerite returns to her old ways and ends up relying more on drugs to get her through the pain of loosing her true love. They see each other again at a kinky ‘prison’ themed sex party and Camille ends up in hospital where the lovers are able to re-unite. The ‘2000’ of the title not a reference to a year but to the number of lovers Armand would have to have before he could forget Marguerite! Based on the novel “The Lady of the Camilias” by Alexandre Dumas. Shot in Rome with music by Piero Piccioni. Cast includes Elenora Rossi, Robert Bisacco.

results.title: Call of the home village = Xiang qing [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jin Wang, Bingliu Hu and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description: One of the first Chinese films to be selected to participate in the Berlin International Film Festival, ‘Xiang Qing’ set a new standard in Chinese film realism. Made on location in Guangong Province, the film tells the story of a young man who has been brought up in the country by a foster mother. On registering to marry his childhood sweetheart, a foster child from the same family, he suddenly discovers his true identity and is reunited with his real parents, high ranking city officials from whom he was separated at birth. The film deals with the discrepancies between rural and city life, and the conflicting loyalties the young man feels towards his two families. Cast: Xiaolei Huang, Yexiang Ren, Wenghua Wu, Zhong Deng. In Mandarin with English subtitles.

results.title: Call of the home village = Xiang qing
results.creator_credit: Li Bangjin, Jin Wang, Bingliu Hu and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Qiuyue’s adopted son, Tiangui is going to marry her daughter, Cuicui. But Tiangui’s biological parents have now learnt where their estranged son is and are against the marriage. Qiuyue sends Tiangui back to his parents, who joined the revolution in the early years and are now senior officials living in the city. Tiangui’s mother is excited to see her son and arrange everything for him to begin a new life. Tiangui is not comfortable with the easy life and misses his foster mum and fiancée in the country. Tiangui’s mother tries all means to prevent her son going back, and she wants Tiangui to marry the daughter of a colleague. Noticing the problem, Tiangui’s father blames his wife and asks Tiangui to invite Qiuyue and Cuicui to their home. However, Tiangui’s mother sends a letter to Qiuyue, telling her that only Cuicui is invited. Tiangui would not go without Qiuyue, and Qiuyue eventually compromises. At Tiangui’s home, Qiuyue accidentally finds out that Tiangui’s parents are the couple that she saved years ago. She did not tell the truth to her children but chose to leave without letting anybody know.

Similar to The Green Mountain of Bamboo (1982), this film also deals with young people’s free love. Traditionally in China, a couple’s marriage would be arranged by their parents. Very often, the couple would have no chance to meet with each other before their wedding day. Arranged marriage is regarded as a “feudal concept” and thus criticized by the CCP. Produced in the early 1980s, this film delivers a message to the audience that CCP members must not be corrupted by feudal ideas. (2 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)
